benchmark_details.name: Water Traversability Dataset
benchmark_details.overview: This paper introduces a dataset of human-annotated water traversability ratings to evaluate foundation models for zero-shot terrain traversability estimation.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To explore zero-shot terrain traversability estimation using vision-language models (VLMs) and to investigate human consensus on water traversability ratings.

data.source: Dataset comprises images from RUGD, RELLIS-3D, self-taken images, and CC-0 online images.
data.annotation: Seven annotators rated traversability on a scale from 1 to 4, based on their estimations.

methodology.calculation: F1 scores were calculated to evaluate the performance of different VLMs in estimating traversability.
methodology.interpretation: F1 scores at most 0.51 indicate limitations in model performance on the evaluated dataset.
methodology.validation: The performance of models was tested against the water traversability dataset.
